unnormalised: Someone asked me about basic cybersecurity tips for India, so here's my 2₹ worth. Seriously though, with increasing reliance on UPI payments and smartphones, digital safety is super important. First things first, update your OS and apps regularly. I know those update notifications are annoying, but they often include security patches. Think of it like this: if your phone's OS is outdated like Windows XP, hackers can exploit known vulnerabilities. So, hit that update button ASAP!
normalised: Someone asked me about basic cybersecurity tips for India, so here's my two rupee worth. Seriously though, with increasing reliance on U-P-I payments and smartphones, digital safety is super important. First things first, update your O-S and apps regularly. I know those update notifications are annoying, but they often include security patches. Think of it like this: if your phone's O-S is outdated like Windows X-P, hackers can exploit known vulnerabilities. So, hit that update button A-S-A-P!

unnormalised: Next, be careful about suspicious links and attachments. Phishing scams are rampant, especially on WhatsApp and SMS. If you receive a message saying you've won ₹50,000 or your SBI account is blocked, think twice before clicking. Verify the sender's identity through official channels. Remember the golden rule: if it sounds too good to be true, it probably is. And use a strong password! Something like "password123" is practically an open invitation for hackers.

If you receive a message saying you've won rupee fifty thousand or your S-B-I account is blocked, think twice before clicking. Verify the sender's identity through official channels. Remember the golden rule: if it sounds too good to be true, it probably is. And use a strong password! Something like "password one two three" is practically an open invitation for hackers.

unnormalised: Finally, install a reliable antivirus app on your phone and computer. I use Kaspersky, but there are many others. Consider using a password manager like LastPass or 1Password to generate and store strong, unique passwords for all your accounts. And back up your data regularly, preferably to the cloud. That way, even if your device is compromised, you won't lose all your important documents and photos. Hope this helps!
